PIONEER DIET: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask., where it will be preserved as part of the permanent record of our Province.

Name ........................................... John Landlaw
Address ........................................... Roseclown Bay 622
Birthplace ........................................... Scotland

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? ........................................... 1883
Where did you set up housekeeping? ........................................... North West Territory near Regina
Where had you been living before that? ........................................... Scotland
For how many people did you prepare meals? ........................................... 7
How far was it to your nearest store? ........................................... 6 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? ........................................... once every two weeks
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? ........................................... Graham ground locally
In what quantities did you buy it? ........................................... 12 Bags
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? ........................................... 1.25
How much did you use graham flour? ........................................... None
Whole wheat flour? ........................................... None
Was flour milled locally? ........................................... Yes How far away? ........................................... 1/4 What year? ........................................... 1883
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? ...........................................
What other grain products did you use? ...........................................
Cornmeal? ........................................... Whole Wheat? ........................................... Farina?
Other? ...........................................
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? ........................................... Yes
How did you grind it? ........................................... In a grain chopper called a cracked wheat

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

Breakfast: Porridge, fried Potatoes, salt pork
Dinner: Roasted Potatoes, salt ham
Supper: Boiled eggs, fried Potatoes, Prunes

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in eastern Canada? Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

Prairie chicken, potatoes, Christmas pudding
John Landlau 40, Mrs. Landlau 35, Robert Landlau 27
Donald Landlau 5, John Landlau 4, Andrew Landlau 2
James Landlau 3, Kate Fraser 22
